title: If you can do something to make something better, why don’t you do it? - Quora

response.answer_text: I know I can make a real difference. I try to the best of my current ability. Life gets in the way of life. I didn’t plan to start trying this year. A life event almost compelled me to start, which was a choice in the end. That was only a few months ago. I’m at a critical point in my career. I have to make some really important decisions soon. I have a selfless dream to help people help themselves. I’ve been through so much in life, I feel like I have so much perspective to offer. I would love to share my life’s wisdom with anyone who cares enough to listen. At the risk of sounding completely delusional, I would love to make a real difference on a ridiculously large scale. I want to end suffering. I know it’s possible. I just haven’t figured out the who, what, when, or where, of it all. Not yet, at least. I’m considering a leap of faith. The why is simple: I care,
I do.Its woven into the fabric that makes up my being.All efforts don't end with success.Some task are effortless,while others need a strategy.
